medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed acute onset right upper quadrant pain about 1 week prior to admission. The pain was severe, lasted throughout the night, and was associated with nausea and vomiting. The next morning, the pain was still present but somewhat improved. Over the following days, the pain waxed and waned in intensity and felt similar to pain experienced prior to gallbladder surgery. Additionally, a few days prior to admission, her urine became dark and she experienced increased constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: ITP, CML, HTN, cholelithiasis s/p CCY, diverticulosis s/p sigmoidectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of heart failure. Brother died of stomach cancer.
